definition[0]: if liquid, gas etc permeates something, it enters it and spreads through every part of it
example[0]: The smell of diesel oil permeated the air.
example[1]: Rain permeates through the ground to add to ground water levels.
definition[1]: if ideas, beliefs, emotions etc permeate something, they are present in every part of it
example[2]: Racism continues to permeate our society.
example[3]: An emotional intensity permeates every one of O'Connorâ€™s songs.
